intro: Acianthera angustifolia, commonly known as the narrow-leaved orchid, is a species of orchid native to South America. It is characterized by its slender, lance-shaped leaves and produces delicate, white or pale pink flowers. The plant typically grows in shaded, moist environments such as forest understories. It belongs to the Orchidaceae family and is known for its compact size and elegant appearance. Acianthera angustifolia is often cultivated for its ornamental value in botanical gardens and greenhouses.
